title: Just Eat investors should hold out for a bigger bite of Takeaway.com merger
text:
Is the great British public losing its appetite for takeaways?

Just Eat left investors with a sour taste in their mouths yesterday (MON) after warning of a “broadly softer consumer spending backdrop”.

In other words, people aren’t reaching for their phones to order a doner kebab from the local Turkish quite so often. The takeaway company’s shares slid more than 6pc as shareholders digested the news.

Is the great takeaway boom over? Interim boss Peter Duffy wouldn’t go that far, but he noted that there is a “structural shift” taking place, with consumers favouring the delivery of faster food such as KFC.

Just Eat’s UK sales grew 8pc in the third quarter. It was quick to insist that it had maintained...
description: Is the great British public losing its appetite for takeaways?
